intro: Scottellia gossweileri, commonly known as the Gossweiler's scottellia, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, daisy-like flowers in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
